intro: Glenniea pervillei, commonly known as the Pervillea glenniea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow blooms. It is well adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Glenniea pervillei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
